meanings.definition: Having a dirty or unkempt appearance
meanings.sent1: The alley behind the restaurant was even skankier than the abandoned house.
meanings.sent2: Her old shoes looked skankier than the new ones she just bought.
meanings.sent3: The skankier the stray dog looked, the more people tried to avoid it.
meanings.sent4: The skankier the pond water, the fewer fish could survive in it.
meanings.sent5: The skankier the cafeteria food smelled, the fewer students wanted to eat it.

meanings.definition: Of low moral character or reputation
meanings.sent1: The skankier the gossip, the faster it spread around the school.
meanings.sent2: He believed his skankier friends were a bad influence on him.
meanings.sent3: The skankier the movie villain, the more the audience loved to hate them.
meanings.sent4: Her skankier actions spoke louder than any words she could say.
meanings.sent5: The skankier the online comments, the more toxic the conversation became.

meanings.definition: More unpleasant or offensive than something else
meanings.sent1: The skankier smell of the garbage bin made her wrinkle her nose in disgust.
meanings.sent2: The skankier behavior of the bullies made the situation even worse.
meanings.sent3: The skankier the prank, the louder the laughter from the group.
meanings.sent4: The skankier the graffiti, the more the city council wanted it removed.
meanings.sent5: The skankier the joke, the more awkward the silence that followed.
